title: Lt. Gov. Duncan aims to make state East Coast tech capital
text:
GAINESVILLE, Ga. (AP) - Georgia’s lieutenant governor is aiming to make the Peach State the “technology capital” of the East Coast.

The Times of Gainesville reports that Republican Lt. Gov. Geoff Duncan outlined his plans at the University of North Georgia’s recent Regional Education and Economic Development Summit.

Duncan said that all companies should be viewed as technology firms.

He also says that Georgia’s kindergarten through 12th grade education system is key to attracting new technology companies to the state. He says investing in education to prepare students for technology jobs will help Georgia create “an ecosystem much like the film industry.”

He says he’s proud of the state legislature’s initiatives to give Georgia teachers pay raises and calls that “a great step forward” in making education a priority.
